title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 October 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:38 <polx> has quit  
02:06 <Denis> has quit  
05:28 <sdumitriu> has quit  
05:29 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki

08:51 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

09:30 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki

09:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <sburjan> Hello. I have released Task Application, could someone check if it's ok on Nexus and promote it ?  
10:43 <tmortagne> sburjan: looking  
10:45 <tmortagne> hmm there is something weird in this version of Nexus  
10:46 <tmortagne> it's even more impossible ti understand than before...  
11:00 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:19 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:17 <polx> has quit  
12:22 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:25 <polx> has quit  
12:25 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <polx> has quit  
13:43 <Slashman> has quit  
14:13 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <npst> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <npst> hello there.  
14:50 <npst> I created a little macro ... but can't can't seem to find a way to display whatever is written in the body-section. My google skills are weak :(  
15:06 <npst> As in .. {{mymacro foo="bar"}}blah{{/mymacro}} how would I use that "blah" in my "Macro Code" section?  
15:20 <tmortagne> npst: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WikiMacroTutorial#HContent seems to be what you are searching for  
15:21 <tmortagne> or then I did not understand exactly what you are searching for :)  
15:38 <polx> has quit  
15:54 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <npst> that looks very promising, tm. thanks :)  
16:07 <npst> yep, that helped. i wonder how i missed that part  
16:08 <vmassol> cool  
16:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: fyi when I ran XE (built from sources) I got:  https://gist.github.com/vmassol/6779419  
16:33 <tmortagne> vmassol: that's weird, sounds like not in sync modules  
16:34 <vmassol> I rebuilt only platform and enterprise  
16:34 <vmassol> and platform I built from my feature branch (but I merged master 1 or 2 hours ago)  
16:34 <vmassol> any I've removed all wikistream jars from my webinf/lib so I'm fine  
16:34 <vmassol> just wanted to let you know in case there's a problem  
16:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks like you did not removed all of them  
16:35 <vmassol> I removed them after the error  
16:35 <vmassol> and now it's ok  
16:35 <tmortagne> I don't have any issue when building so I don't see how XE could have a missing class  
16:35 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:36 <tmortagne> and seems like you were able to build platform too  
16:38 <npst> has quit  
16:43 <polx> has quit  
16:43 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <polx> has quit  
16:50 <vmassol> any idea why this is not valid XWQL:  
16:50 <vmassol> ?  
16:51 <cjd> missing a "where" ?  
16:51 <vmassol> argh  
16:51 <vmassol> thanks :)  
16:51 <vmassol> was blind  
16:51 <cjd> nps  
16:51 <cjd> second set of eyes  
16:51 <vmassol> yup  
16:52 <vmassol> err doesn't help  
16:52 <vmassol> wait  
16:52 <vmassol> works  
16:52 <vmassol> :)  
16:52 <vmassol> (typo)  
16:57 <tmortagne> vmassol: btw DocumentInstanceOutputEventReader does not exists since https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/68149f7de418d07a13dd524ac2b76c021aab4284 so I doubt your branch is up to date  
16:58 <vmassol> strange I've done a "mvn merge master" this morning  
16:58 <vmassol> git  
16:58 <vmassol> not mvn  
16:58 <vmassol> ;)  
17:00 <tmortagne> maybe you did not pulled before  
17:02 <vmassol> I'm the only one working on that branch...  
17:05 <tmortagne> pulled master  
17:06 <tmortagne> merge only merge what you have locally  
17:08 <vmassol> really? I remember discussing this on this irc channel  
17:08 <vmassol> and I was told that the right way was not to do pull but merge  
17:13 <vmassol> trying it now  
17:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: I mean doing pull on master, then checkout your branch and merge master  
17:16 <tmortagne> in any case "git merge master" merge your local master branch with your current branch  
17:16 <tmortagne> so if you did not fetched or pulled before then yes you did not merged the last version of master  
17:16 <vmassol> indeed, I think i did a pull on master but not sure  
17:16 <evalica> has quit  
17:17 <vmassol> my master is usually quite up to date but if this change was very recent it's possible I didn't have it  
17:17 <tmortagne> I guess you can do things like "git merge origin/master" (bu still need a fetch I think)  
17:17 <vmassol> I've just done this on the branch;  
17:17 <vmassol> git pull origin master  
17:18 <vmassol> it crated a new commit but it seems empty  
17:19 <tmortagne> not sure directly doing a pull on a branch is very clean  
17:19 <tmortagne> better be safe and pull only corresponding branches I think  
17:20 <vmassol> wow this is a mess, just done a git checkout master and now I have tons of changes on my master...  
17:20 <tmortagne> ha platform build fail on packager plugin, since it moved to 5.3-SNAPSHOT probably as usual  
17:24 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks like your last commit on feature-resource-and-wiki-modules is a merge or several commits from master in one  
17:25 <vmassol> yes, but you made changes to master in the meantime, so I don't know exactly what happened. I'm rebuilding, i'll see how it goes  
17:26 <polx> has joined #xwiki
